results.question: A(n) ________ is the matching of a specific resource to a particular task to do work.
Assigning a(n) ______ or ________ resource to a task will not affect the duration of the task.
In Microsoft Project, when you assign a human or equipment resource to a task, the result is _______.
_______ is the amount of work periods you expect the task to take to complete.
If a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal work capacity of the resource, it is ________.
The capacity of a resource to work is measured in ______.
In Microsoft Project, Duration × Units = Work is known as the ______.
Effort‐driven scheduling adjusts a task's duration only if you add or remove ________ from a task.
When you assign ________ to tasks, you can track their consumption and cost.
According to the work formula in Microsoft Project, 20 hours task duration × 200% assignment units = _______hours work.
If you assign a resource to a task with more units than the resource has available, then the resource is considered to be which of the following?
Which of the following lets you choose the scheduling option you need?
A task plus a resource equals which of the following?
If, on an effort‐driven task, after an initial assignment, you assign more resources to a task, which of the following happens to the task's duration?
Where do you normally record the dollar value of the cost resources for your project?
results.correct_answer: on the Resource Sheet in the Cost column
incorrect_answers: on the Resource Sheet in the Std. Rate column
in the Assign Resources dialog box when the cost resource is assigned

results.question: The first time you are making resource assignments to a task, and you assign two resources at the same time, each at 100% assignment units, to a task with 24 hours duration, each resource will work on the task for how long?

To assign more than one resource to a task using the Assign Resources dialog box, click on the first resource name, then hold down the ______ key while clicking the second resource name, and then click Assign.
Which of the following is an advantage of assigning resources to tasks?
results.correct_answer: All of the above are advantages of assigning resources to tasks.
incorrect_answers: You can see if the resource assignment affects task duration.
You can track the progress of the resource in working on the task.
You can track resource and task costs.

results.question: If you assign a(n) _______________ quantity of a material resource to a task, Microsoft Project will adjust the quantity and cost of the resource as the task's duration changes.
You can assign resources to tasks using all of the following methods, except the _______________.
results.correct_answer: Resource tab on the Task Information dialog box
